p: It is well known that exposure to atmospheric contaminants modulate the host’s inflammatory response leading to an overexpression of inflammatory cytokines and chemokines ( Gouda et al., 2018). Clear effects of Milan winter PM 2.5 were observed on elevated production of interleukin IL-6 and IL-8 in human bronchial cells ( Longhin et al., 2018), and also NO 2 was shown to correlate with IL-6 levels on inflammatory status ( Perret et al., 2017). The impairment of respiratory system and chronic disease by air pollution can thus facilitate viral infection in lower tracts ( Shinya et al., 2006; van Riel et al., 2006).
